alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 3:18AM CST until December 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Today Through Thursday... A wintry mix continues in north-central Wisconsin this morning with multiple rounds of precipitation persisting into Thursday. Icing, especially on elevated surfaces such as bridges, may result in slippery to hazardous driving conditions as well as tree damage from winds gusting near 45 mph. This wintry mix will alleviate midday before another round of snow develops tonight. Several inches of snow are possible Wednesday night in north- central Wisconsin. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snowfall expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, a mix of precipitation is expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations nearing a tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN... Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening and Winter Storm Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
